intro: Celsia collina, commonly known as the mountain celsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Celsia collina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
